Title: D-Bus: Denial of service
Synopsis:
A vulnerability has been found in D-Bus which allows a local user
    to cause a Denial of Service.

Background.Text: D-Bus is a message bus system which processes can use to talk to each other.

Description.Text: D-Busâ€™ _dbus_printf_string_upper_bound() function crashes if it returns exactly 1024 bytes.

Impact.Text: A local attacker could provide specially-crafted input to an application using D-Bus which would cause _dbus_printf_string_upper_bound() to return 1024 bytes and crash, causing a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All D-Bus users should upgrade to the latest version:
